title: Mikaels is a great example of what skill expression in a support should be
body:
Anyone who has ever played support knows that Mikaels active is very hard to use optimally especially in teamfights where so much stuff is going on that it's hard to keep track of your own champion let alone the positions and cc standings of all 5. Mikaels offers a depth of skill expression to an enchanter support thats not really seen elswhere in their items. Mikaels also has the added benefit of being extremely rewarding to get off at the crucial moment in a teamfight when the enemy lulu polymorphed your adc and you insta-cleansed it winning you the teamfight. mikaels is rewarding fun and hard to use and i love the item personally.

I would like to see items that allow more skill expression with their actives instead of stat sticks with ardent censer.

Also what I'm saying isn't solely accidental use of Mikael's; just simply mistiming it wastes it as well. It's hard to "mistime" Redemption as a massive heal is almost never bad.

It's really usefull for all kinds of champions, i buy it often on Sion for the stats and the active

The item is really powerful at punishing enemies for using their cc

I often use it to enable friendly juggernauts, they get cc'd and slows and the kitchen sink thrown at them and i give the enemy team the middle finger by cleansing my juggerbro and sending him off with speed and slow immunity after they wasted their hard cc on him :D

Eh, just wondering. Is {{item:3222}} really able to cleanse Polymorph? People often think it works on suppression and blinds, you know. Making sure this isn't another case. o.o
It does. But for whatever reason, {{item:3140}} works on suppressions while {{item:3222}} doesn't.

I think Riot's idea with it not working on suppressions is if there were two items that worked against it then WW, Malz, and Skarner would be really bad.

The reason they choose QSS over Mikael's is Mikael's can only be used if the user isn't impaired so it cannot be used to save yourself from a suppression.

Not sure why you were downvoted, because you are correct.

The issue with giving Mikael's suppression removal, is that is completely invalidates Warwick, Malzahar and Skarner's ultimates in team fights.

Why would your carries ever invest in QSS, when your support could just build Mikael's? The threat of a suppression ultimate is arguably their biggest strengths, because everyone is sacrificing 1k+ gold to deal with it, and that gold is not then going into damage.

He might got downvoted,because for one,I'm reading it now,it doesn't make sense.

They gave QSS,an item that you can use on yourself at any given time while it's not on CD,but Mikaels,which requires  your ally to be near and have good reflexes, not?Not to mention you can't use Mikaels when you,yourself are under CC.
It seems like  Mikael's would have more counterplay than QSS.

Mikaels clearing suppression effect seems much healthier than on QSS or?

My 2 cents, a support with Mikael's can remove CC from anyone, while if each teammate bought QSS it would be a much bigger gold investment per total.

Sure, a Mikael support might not be able to cleanse an entire team, but they can respond to a suppression on any teammate* (but themselves), effectively saving their team thousands of gold.




\*the only problem arrives when the enemy team has a lot of AoE CC

So it's basically between;
Cleansing everyone,but yourself vs Cleansing yourself (even when CCed)
I don't think every support skill should be activating an item. I'd be ok with having fewer support items with activate abilities.
I disagree, it's an active item. Skill expression should be part of the individual champions' kits. Its rewards should scale with items.
supports have a unique niche in balancing active items so i believe that it does count as skill expression with a high reward if you decide you want the item
It's kinda silly that Supports can end up running around with 3-4 actives and most champions have none or 1

It's funny that you mention that, considering every base support item fully built has an active {{item:3401}} {{item:2302}} {{item:2303}} {{item:3092}} {{item:3069}} {{item:2301}} 

To me it would just make sense that they'd be given multiple items with actives though, considering how game changing the support role actually is.

A small shield from face of the mountain, or even a ward placed from the active on a sightstone can mean the difference between your team getting aced, and acing the enemy team.

It kind of inspires me to become a better support when I think about it like that.

The thing is- at some point you basically become two champions due to all the actives. Which is kind of a design problem when a Support with no shields or heals in their kit can end up shielding and healing their entire team through items alone.

Mikael's is basically a shittier version of QSS, if anything.

For reference, its CD is almost twice of that of QSS's, and it doesn't even remove suppressions, while a QSS can.

If its active CD were to be lowered, I would actually consider it not completely shitty. In comparison of how powerful Ardent Censer and Redemption are, there's not much reason for any support to build Mikael's at all.

On a side note, it IS powerful when used correctly, but isn't really mandatory to win. Your ADC most of the time knows better when to use QSS anyways, or hopefully...
I like Mikaels but hate that I rarely get to use it because the prevalence of knock-ups makes it worthless half the time. :(

First off, the amount of skill required to use it is huge in comparison to ANY other item. It's basiclly Azir of items. Pros can use it, but for the majority of the playerbase it's not viable.
This in turns creates another issue: casual players does't know how to  support so he coppys some pro build, which includes this item, fail to use it effectivly, feels like as support he doesnt do anything and drops the role.
I see this item built on low elo supports quite often and i honestly doubt they can use it, this item is probably partly at fault for the low number of support players.
lastly it has simply bad stats(most likely to compensate for the active).

I actually don't like the item, i think it's a horrible item.

I use it "proactively" rather than reactively, in a sense because reacting is difficult to prepare for while using it proactively requires timing but can be prepared for. 

E.g. with the popular Kayle/Yi strat, I've played this match countless times as Kayle support having  Yasuo/Yi/Tryndamere/Vayne/whatever hypercarry. Thing is, a fed Yi is going to want to initiate the fight (which is usually dumb). However, with my ult burst is not an issue, but CC still is. However, you can easily foresee that the enemy is going to dump every single cc on him as soon as he gets in range, so it works if he kind of goes in recklessly without dodging any CC and you sort of pre-emptively click him as soon as he gets in range to be CC'd. Kind of like a Sivir W bait, it usually works quite well.

I can't use it on an ADC as a peel though, but predicting and using makes it easier.

Just because you explain how to use it, it  doesnt change the fact that it's still a really hard to use item, requiring quite precise timing. 

no other item really demands that.

Redemption requires even more timing because it has a delay to activation, which is why I feel it is hard to use as well. Locket also works similarly to Mikael's but pre-empting damage for it is somewhat easier because it is aoe so you just need a rough idea when damage is going to be incoming and not on who.

But all of them require quite good timing, only that Mikael's has a slightly higher requirement for it.

Redemption is easy, it also deals damage, all you have to do is use where the teamfight is going on, the wind up will scare enemy away (or deal damage) and teammates will stay in it for the heal. It's very likely to do something either way, as long as you don't place it in a completly different place(most likely by missclicking).
You can ues locket preemptivly to negate some damage, but even if you miss it, and do it after it, it's still gonna be usefull because teamfight will continue and damage will still be absorbed.
Sure you can use those items with maximum skill for perfect timing, but even if you miss  it's still gonna be usefull, but with Michaels you don't have that kind of luxury, you either cleanse that 1 second lasting cc or you completly wasted it. With Michaels you have to perfect time it, there's no consolation price for trying.

While i agree, there are other active items like mikaels that are also good examples. Like Face of the Mountain, or Zekes take a bit, Redemption while a good teamfight utility, if not used MID teamfight can be a bit harder than other items.

Sure there are slightly easier ones like Talisman or Knights Vow.

However one thing i want to stress is not ALL of Supports difficulty should be in Active Items. Tanks Especially suffer from this. If all you have are actives their stats will be lower as such because of the actives. And while enchanters dont need to be on the front line, tank supports do. Enchanters could use more HASP too. Supports can use stat-stick items catered to them too.
Ardent is a bit overtuned right now but with a nerf here and there (i dont actually know if the current nerf changed much but it mightve) having a stat-stick item is fine.

What do you think of this?

I think that items that simply grant passives is fine but i would like to see rewarding yet hard stuff like mikaels in the form of an update to some supports

Honestly what i really want is a thresh of enchanter supports as my end all be all goal
